head.title: Dodge Foundation Names Its New Director

hedline.hl1: Dodge Foundation Names Its New Director

abstract.p: David Grant is named to succeed Geraldine R Dodge Foundation director Scott McVay, effective October 1 (S)

block.p: David Grant, a consultant for school districts on curriculum design and teacher training, has been named executive director of the Geraldine R. Dodge Foundation in Morristown to succeed Scott McVay, director of the foundation since its inception in 1976. (Mr. VcVay was profiled in this section on March 29.) The appointment of Mr. Grant, 48, of Norwich, Vt., is effective Oct. 1. The foundation, established with a $60 million bequest in the will of Geraldine Rockefeller Dodge of Madison, has made $164 million in grants to promote education, the arts and animal welfare.
